meanings.sent1: She was caught plagiarizing her friend's homework.
meanings.sent2: The student plagiarized the article and got in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The parrot hilariously plagiarized the owner's words.
meanings.sent4: His actions plagiarized the plot of a famous movie.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was so similar, it seemed plagiarized.

meanings.definition: To use and pass off as one's own (the ideas or writings of another).
meanings.sent1: He plagiarized the entire paragraph from the internet.
meanings.sent2: The author was accused of plagiarizing a famous novel.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly plagiarized his friend's jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her speech plagiarized the words of a renowned speaker.
meanings.sent5: The student's essay was clearly plagiarized from a book.

meanings.definition: To copy (the ideas or writings of another) and pass them off as one's own.
meanings.sent1: The artist plagiarized the painting and claimed it as original.
meanings.sent2: She was expelled for plagiarizing her classmate's project.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully plagiarized the recipe from a famous cookbook.
meanings.sent4: His work plagiarized the style of a well-known designer.
meanings.sent5: The website's content was blatantly plagiarized from another source.
